intro: Malvaviscus palmatus, commonly known as the palmate mallows, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds.
